contentfulPagePressRelease.title: QF Radio Celebrates End of 2015-2016 Academic Year

childMarkdownRemark.html:
QF Radio, the in-house broadcasting station for Qatar Foundation (QF), recently celebrated the completion of the 2015-2016 season of programing with an appreciation ceremony that marked the accomplishments of its students and staff.

The event, which took place in Education City, held particular significance for QF Radio which, this year, collaborated with a record number of students, QF centres and organizations to bring a selection of diverse and exciting programs to the local community.

As a defining factor of this year’s shows, QF Radio acknowledged the contribution of youth in shaping the country’s future development and growth, by producing programs which have helped to address the Grand Challenges facing Qatar.
“The station is determined to attract as many Qatari youth as possible," Mr Mohammed Al Beshri, Media Centre Manager, said. "Our in-house training courses have provided young men and women with the fundamental knowledge and experience needed to work in real-world media environments.”

During this year’s ceremony, over 30 students, faculty and staff were celebrated for their commitment to delivering quality programmes in the fields of science and technology, health, medicine, design, travel and culture. These topics reflect QF’s vision to support human, social and economic development in Qatar.

For the full story, please click here.
